ARABIC: وَقَالُوا۟ لَوْلَا نُزِّلَ هَٰذَا ٱلْقُرْءَانُ عَلَىٰ رَجُلٍ مِّنَ ٱلْقَرْيَتَيْنِ عَظِيمٍ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They say, 'Why was this Qur'an not sent down to one of the great men of the two cities?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They also said: "Why was this Qur'an not sent down to some great man of the two cities?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: They say: “Why was this Qur'an not sent down upon some great man from the two (main) cities?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Then they said, "Why this Quran had not been revealed to a man from either of the two great towns".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And they said, “Why was the Qur’an not sent down upon some chieftain of these two great towns?” (The chiefs of Mecca and Taif).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And they say: "Why is not this Qur'an sent down to some great man of the two towns"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And they say: Why was not this Quran revealed to a man of importance in the two towns?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: They say, 'Why was this Koran not sent down upon some man of moment in the two cities?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And they say: If only this Qur'an had been revealed to some great man of the two towns?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: They said, "Why was this Quran not sent down to one of the great men of the two cities?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And they say: wherefore hath not this Qur'an been revealed to a man of the two cities who was great.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And they said, ‘Why was not this Quran sent down to some great man from the two cities?’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Also, they say: "Why is not this Qur'an sent down to some leading man in either of the two (chief) cities?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And they say: "Why is not this Quran sent down to some great man of the two towns (Makkah and Ta'if)?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: They also said: 'Why was this Koran not sent down to a great man from the two Villages'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: They also said, “If only this Quran was sent down to a man of importance from the two cities.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And they said, "Why was this Qur'an not sent down upon a great man from [one of] the two cities?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [43:31] And they said, ‘If only this Qur’ān had been revealed to some great man from, the inhabitants of, the two towns!’, in other words, from either of the two; such as al-Walīd b. al-Mughīra at Mecca or ‘Urwa b. Mas‘ūd al-Thaqafī at Tā’if.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And they) i.e. the people of Mecca: al-Walid and his host (say: If only this Qur'an had been revealed to some great man of the two towns) i.e. to al-Walid Ibn al-Mughirah and Abu Mas'ud al-Thaqafi from Mecca and Ta'if respectively?
